website_summaries.verdict: A good option for users who need reliable wire cutters for occasional household tasks without the multi-tool functions of other models.
pros: This model is a great tool for small household tasks such as trimming and splicing wires
It is lightweight and thin making it easy to use for just about anyone, yet the carbon steel material will hold up for a long time with occasional usage
The slim .39-inch blade makes these wire cutters a great option for jewelry making or crafts as well
cons: This model is not intended for frequent cutting of heavy gauge wire, and will wear out quickly with such usage

customer_reviews.title: Cuts nicely for price, works for Gunpla.
customer_reviews.text: Great cutters. They cut fairly cleanly and the pressure required to close is quite stiff and nice. I use these cutters to cut out models/plastic (Gunpla, specifically), and while they're no God Hand or Tamiya nippers, for the price, this is a great buy. Might seem a little silly, but the reason I can't give it a 5 star is that the handle absolutely reeks of rubber/plastic out of the package. I've had it for about a week now as I write this, and it still smells a bit. Not as bad as it was, but on the first day I had to wash my hands pretty hard to get the smell off.
customer_reviews.author: app1

customer_reviews.title: Great nippers, super sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Hi quality precision nippers. I don’t have the packaging any longer but I believe they are made in Japan the land of high quality steel. They fit my needs perfectly and have comfortable grips which are red color to easily spot on my work bench. They are Super sharp. My only complaint is since they are spring loaded I wish they had a way to keep them closed when not in use. But that is minor. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent L

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BELIEVE THE DESCRIPTION
customer_reviews.text: Ripped off! These have about a 12 degree angle - nowhere close to the 45 degrees specified. These are just like all the others out there. They know most people won't go through the hassle of returning them so they just promise one thing and send another.
customer_reviews.author: Orcanator

customer_reviews.title: I am extremely happy. don't try to cut stuff they are not ...
customer_reviews.text: These do very well for what they are designed for. I am extremely happy. don't try to cut stuff they are not designed to cut..... these are for leads from resistors, 1 watt and below. small wire diameters maybe 22 gauge max and copper or lighter. but for snipping down to the solder, great!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Q1

customer_reviews.title: Mini angled wire cutters
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I received them. I would like to say that these wire cutters are very comfortable for in your hands, they don't slip out of your hands either. They are really great for getting into right work areas to make precision cuts. I like that they are compact also. Their is one thing that would be nice though is to add a small locking hook to keep them closed for when storing them say in your took box or took bag when not in use, because I've noticed that the tips of the cutting edges are very sharp. So all in all I would strongly recommend these to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Tazdog 417

customer_reviews.title: I'm an aerospace machinist and I am PICKY about side-cutters
customer_reviews.text: These are great, perfectly flush cuts and on the money for value. I research my purchases whether they are for $3 or $300 - and I did my homework on these. Thought they aren't the German ones I get at work, those cost about ten times as much. These work great and are on the cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Ethan L.

customer_reviews.title: These are great little cutters
customer_reviews.text: These are great little cutters. They're very sharp and trim zip ties perfectly flush so you don't have the sharp edges in your wire bundles. My wife uses them for trimming her cuticles and nails... Lol. Guess I'm going to get one for her so I can keep mine.
customer_reviews.author: gerald cook

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cutting Tennis String but not durable
customer_reviews.text: I use these to cut tennis string. They are so much better then Xuron for this purpose. The cut is clean and they feel great in my hand. Update: just broke after 6 months of use. One of the bladed broke off when trying to cut a thin piece of wire.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Schank

customer_reviews.title: Cuts well
customer_reviews.text: This cuts zip ties really well, smooth and first try. But the grip is very wide. I don't have small hands (I wear large/XL gloves), and this is sometimes difficult to grab and grip with one hand. They could have made the handles with less of an angle I think, there's no need for them to be that wide.
customer_reviews.author: J. Alberts

customer_reviews.title: Cut ok, but handles have an odor issue
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as offset snips to get into tiny margins between paper-crafting dies to cut adjoining dies apart. These wire cutters work pretty well for that. The big issue is that the plastic handles stink... as in they fill my craftroom with a foul chemical odor. The odor also rubs off onto my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Chris & Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: They seem to be made well enough and cut just fine. I've had others that were not ground properly and had soft steel. These ones have a somewhat rough grind but the cutting edge is sharp, lines up correctly, and the steel is sufficiently hardened.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Good Little Cutters - Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: These are great little cutters. I like using them, and they seem to be well made. I have used them on smaller gauge wire, and some plastic parts. If you want little cutters of this type, I think these are a excellent choice. And, they are offered on Amazon at a good, fair price.
customer_reviews.author: jimdeeisme

customer_reviews.title: I was able to use some pliers to adjust one of the jaws to be better aligned but still not
customer_reviews.text: Cutting edges don't line up perfectly and it's a bit irritating when trying to cut even small wire and the jaws slip past one another and just bent your wire. I was able to use some pliers to adjust one of the jaws to be better aligned but still not perfect
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool is so great, I bought a second one. I use one in my cable zip ties box to perfectly cut off the ends after tightening the tie.
customer_reviews.author: Steven E.

customer_reviews.title: Good precision wire cutters
customer_reviews.text: Nice little wire cutters for the price. Very sharp and solidly built with good alignment at the blades. Comfortable grip with good spring tension. I would buy these again, they are great for many tasks that require a precision cutter.
customer_reviews.author: J. Leenan

customer_reviews.title: Great for small wire clipping. 24+ gauge
customer_reviews.text: Don't put 1000lbs of pressure to cut wires. These are not bolt cutters. You don not need to squeeze the handles so hard that you trow off the rivet that joins the handles. Fineness, that is what these give you.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Ocampo

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to cut closed jewelry rings. It does the job easily and perfectly. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: R.Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Very good cutters for the hobbiest
customer_reviews.text: I use cutters all the time in my 3D printing hobby. These cutters are great to use for cutting filament and for removing supports from thin parts. So far no issues at all with a good deal of use. The handles are comfortable and the cutters are sharp. Capable of very flush cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Pollard

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Broke from the first usr. Not worth a penny. Never buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3D Printing Essential
customer_reviews.text: These make it very easy to cut edges in 3D prints, up against surfaces and crevices; I use this all the time to remove support beams.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Person

customer_reviews.title: Great price for value.
customer_reviews.text: I love these cutters. I use them to cut stems on silk flowers and for jewelry cutting metal these cutters work so well. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: annette

customer_reviews.title: They Cut Things, Quite Flushingly, Exactly What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: Will it cut? Yes, it will cut. Will it kill? Unlikely. They cut things flush and haven't broken yet, which are the two most important factors I consider when evaluating flush cutters.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Schmitz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size.
customer_reviews.text: Using for cutting parts from trees in building a plastic model car or clipping leads on soldered components, this is a nice, small and comfortable tool.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Needed this small tool to cut through old cable ties. Works fine.
customer_reviews.author: S&H

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp, fit and finish is good. They are tight enough so that the cutting surfaces meet exactly. You can cut paper with these things like scissors. Highly recommended for this price point.
customer_reviews.author: JRod

customer_reviews.title: sharp
customer_reviews.text: bought it for work, great cutters, sharp even after a year of use. Decided to buy for home too
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: one of the tips snapped after 3x of use. ...
customer_reviews.text: one of the tips snapped after 3x of use. Still sharp as hell and i suppose because it's so sharp durability takes a hit.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Reminds me of my Nantech kit except the price is much better. I like that it includes everything you might need to take whatever you need apart. The tweezers are a bit subpar, but they're certainly good enough for most uses.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L.

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality cutters
customer_reviews.text: I do not expect to struggle with new wire cutters. The metal blades are much too soft.
customer_reviews.author: R. Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the money.
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good for the money. Using them to cut guitar strings damages the Cutting Edge. I replaced them with a set of Klein's after about a year or so. Maybe less. The Kleins are only a couple of dollars more and worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice flush cut.  On the smaller side.
customer_reviews.text: Wish these were a bit larger. They work fine for my needs at this point. If I really get into wire I"ll have to switch to a beefier product tho.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal W.Top Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: These little cutters work well. I bought them for use with my 3D printer, and they have been a reliable tool for snipping bits of plastic filament.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Truitt

customer_reviews.title: ... used them a couple of times but they are nice flush cutters for electronics and small gauge wiring use
customer_reviews.text: Have only used them a couple of times but they are nice flush cutters for electronics and small gauge wiring use. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ISAAC

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and sharp
customer_reviews.text: I love these small wire cutters. They are perfect for cutting wire for my bonsai trees.
customer_reviews.author: Poodle Person

customer_reviews.title: Good for what you need doing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these primarily for use with plastic model kits, and they haven't disappointed in the slightest. A good product for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: William Rendfeld

customer_reviews.title: Flush cutting!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed, very little sanding/cleanup after nipping from sprues.
customer_reviews.author: Ned Flanders

customer_reviews.title: It's reliable and store was very helpful
customer_reviews.text: The product wasn't something that I expect but if you compare it with the price/product, it's reliable. On the other hand, the store was very helpful and they contacted me in person and listened my problems. Thank you very much.
customer_reviews.author: Ersin Gungormus

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I did not like anything about this product it broke after the first use it's a waste of time Amazon should take it off their list
customer_reviews.author: gregg hayden

customer_reviews.title: Great value 👍
customer_reviews.text: These clippers were perfect for working on my Samsung plasma screen x-board. They were sharp enough to cut what I needed with no issue. Great addition to the toolbox
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Price

customer_reviews.title: Works well for modeling
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for cutting scale model parts. They cut close and clean for that purpose. A good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Tommygun

customer_reviews.title: In the beginning as I used the cutters they seemed ...
customer_reviews.text: In the beginning as I used the cutters they seemed ok. As time goes by there’s marring on the sharp edges and not working as well!
customer_reviews.author: JaMo

customer_reviews.title: worked outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for one specific purpose and they outdid themselves. They worked splendidly.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: but was disappointed to see that the blade chipped on a simple ...
customer_reviews.text: They work, but was disappointed to see that the blade chipped on a simple small wire cut. I could not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Nifty tool for light weight cutting
customer_reviews.text: Makes nice flush cuts for small gauge wires and breadboard components.
customer_reviews.author: Archie Md

customer_reviews.title: Product cuts well
customer_reviews.text: Product is comfortable, cuts well, and seems to do a good job.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these for making jewelry. Both broke within an hour of use. Cutter part just snaps. Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and very effective
customer_reviews.text: Did a personal project that required some wire cutting recently and these cutters went trough them fairly easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Cutters
customer_reviews.text: My 4th set of cutters and finally a pair I love that works great.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Baker

customer_reviews.title: Fine Tool
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Worked great in a small work area. Compared to another pair I bought at the same time for a project, these were the better pair.
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Park

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, but don't cut flush
customer_reviews.text: They don't close flush. They can get the job done but don't expect high quality flush cutting. I use this as a hobby tool for Metal Earth kits.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Too bad man.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for cutting in between the half-inch squares of hardware cloth which is similar to the thickness of chicken wire. Must say, they worked great...except about the third time I used them they broke...snapped like a little dry twig. So much for the carbon steel. Too bad man.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality and Durable
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for a while and still looking and working as new.
customer_reviews.author: Deives

customer_reviews.title: Good cutters
customer_reviews.text: These are great little cutters, easy to hold and cut well.
customer_reviews.author: Annadolyn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: perfect! small size, great spring action, sharp blades, comfy grips.....exactly what I was looking for to cut zipties
customer_reviews.author: Keith Morgan

customer_reviews.title: What can you say about cheap flush cutting pliers. ...
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about cheap flush cutting pliers. You use them till they get gaps in them and then throw them away and order another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Mancel Prince

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for hobbyists
customer_reviews.text: Good feel and smooth cutting, but the tip was not ground to a point and had to be adjusted on my own grinding wheel.
customer_reviews.author: AZChas

customer_reviews.title: Do not cut at the tip
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use these for cutting my banjo strings. The tip of the cutters does not cut anything. I would return them if I still had the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I use it to cut the leads off of through hole parts after soldering. It does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TGK Review
customer_reviews.text: great product. sharp and tough check out video for more
customer_reviews.author: Kni Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great jewelry tool
customer_reviews.text: This flush cutter is wonderful for jewelry making. It is very sharp and gets into small spaces. Great item!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Ranieri

customer_reviews.title: Nicely done...sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike, works as advertised for cutting printing filament.
customer_reviews.author: havebrewwilltravel

customer_reviews.title: Great for building coils
customer_reviews.text: These work great! Use em for cutting wire when building my own coils for my vape. No complaints so far
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stinky cutter
customer_reviews.text: They work, but the handles stink so bad and it gets on your hands even after cleaning them. Use these with gloves
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel Martir

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use For safery wire.
customer_reviews.text: Won’t cut safety wire. After a while😅. Other than that worked great
customer_reviews.author: kag

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: Easy to carry, is a good helper to repair the computer, give my husband he very likes, he say he need of these, but also thank me!
customer_reviews.author: Rong L.

customer_reviews.title: Razor sharp and cut flush.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted these for flush cutting plastic zip ties and they're excellent. Razor sharp and cut flush.
customer_reviews.author: B.Cully

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it just can’t be beat. Excellent for component leads, much more flush than other brands and effortless.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Walters

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CLIPPERS AND AN EXCELLENT VALUE
customer_reviews.text: If you are like me (a weekend home handyman) you already know how quickly (it seems) your wire cutters and many other tools become dull and rusted. I treat mine regularly with WD40, but, because of the humidity in the Southeastern US, tools left in a shed or garage become rusty and lose their cutting edge, it seems, every year or two. So far these cutters (made of carbon-steel) are holding up very well. They are extremely sharp and tough little buggers ... and I think it would be very difficult for someone to duplicate their quality from a national brand hardware store at 'three times' their price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Steven Thomas

customer_reviews.title: They seem very well made.
customer_reviews.text: They are really nicely machined, down to an extremely sharp edge that looks like it will hold up well. I’ve been cutting a lot of 20 gauge kanthal with these and so far I don’t see any nicks in the edge. Way more precise than normal dikes and plenty powerful for cutting medium gauge copper and light gauge ferrous wire.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: great for soft metals (copper, etc)
customer_reviews.text: Keep it away from cutting steel and they are great
customer_reviews.author: guckrob

product_meta.title: TGK Wire Cutters Micro Shear Flush Cutter 45 Degree Carbon Steel Flush Cut 3d Printer Pliers 5inch, Red
product_meta.description:
Wire Cutters Micro Shear Flush Cutter 45 Degree Carbon Steel Flush Cut Pliers 5inch Red 
Warranty: we offer 1 year warranty, If you have any problem, pls contact us. 

Description:
1.45-Degree Angle use in tight spaces
45-Degree Angle Oblique Relieved Head and Angled Jaw 22.5-Degree 
2 .Size: Blade size 0.39inch, total length: 5 inch, Weight:77.5g
3. Light weight, thin profile and easy handling insulate grips comfortable for operation, Spring loaded for easy use
4. Suitable for cutting wire, electronic feet, trimming plastic products, cutting small metal wire, repairing of electronics industry, jewelry processing, model making and so on.
5. Package Include: Wire Cutters Carbon Steel Flush Cut Pliers Micro Shear Flush Cutter
6. Do not over used.

Suitable for cutting wire, electronic feet, trimming plastic products, cutting small metal wire, repairing of electronics industry, jewelry processing, model making and so on.
